題目: You are a human resources assistant. Some employees complained that their superiors keep sending messages or emails to them after work hours and expect instant replies. They feel that there is no more free time even after work. Write an article for the company newsletter describing the situation and discussing what a healthy work style should be like.







Importance of Free Time after Work
There has been a hot topic in our company, which is some employees complaining that their superiors keep sending messages or emails to them no matter it has passed work hour. If you hang out with your colleague at the weekend, you can easily see that they are replying messages from their superiors, or even sending emails in the restaurant, using a laptop. I uphold the belief that such way of working does not bring us benefit. It is certainly detrimental to both the employees themselves and the company.

To employees, there would be problems occurred in their families if they need to reply to their superiors after work hours. Since the time after working is the only time for them to stay with their family, if they often checked their mobile, it would damage the relationship with other family members. Imagine that when your children are playing mobile games during dinner, you must feel bad because dinner time is for gathering and sharing, it is not for using mobile. Having the same situation, when you need to reply to your boss, your family members would also feel unwell.

The company will get no benefit too, because the more the employees work does not mean the more the profits. As the working hours are so long in Hong Kong, which is eight to nine hours a day, how can the employees work efficiently after this long period? However, the employees need to ensure their works done instantly, so their works will become lower quality, for example some errors in the email or messages. Having this kind of low-quality work, the company may lose the customers in the long term. Finally, our profits would not increase but decrease.

For the betterment of the situation, we should have a healthy work style. The most important part of the healthy work style is reducing the amounts of messages sent after work hours. Even though the messages are very urgent, the superiors should not expect employee’s instant replies. It is very important that letting the employees rest after working hours. Moreover, for the employees, you can have some exercises after work, like running or swimming. The gym room in our company is welcome to all of you too. Doing all of these, our company can obtain a healthy work style.

Employees are an important role in a company, so that we must ensure a good mental health of each employee, in order to make our company progresses.

2. Learning English through Sports Communication
Because of the lack of sports facilities, some people in your community have suggested that schools should allow the public to use their sports facilities after school hours.
Write a letter to the editor of the Hong Kong Daily stating your opinion. Support your opinion with three reasons.


Dear Editor,

I am writing to express my concern over the issue regarding allowing the public to use the sports facilities of the school after school hours, which has given rise to the heated discussion. From my perspective, I strongly oppose to this issue. Here are some reasons accounting for my view.

More people from the public may increase crimes occurred at school. Since the schools allow the public to use the facilities, anyone can enter the school without being checked or permitted. As a result, it may attribute to the surge in crimes, such as robbery and thieving. Schools’ and students’ properties may be damaged. Besides, students’ safety will be at stake if gangs wander around the school. Students might join the gangs since their minds are not mature enough. Therefore, it is clearly shown that students safety is undermined if this measure is implemented. On the other hand, no one will be responsible for monitoring the school campus after office hours as most teachers leave. When students study at school after the office hours, their safety will be threatened. Under the circumstances, I do not support this measure.

Aside from the safety reason, we should also consider the resources at school. Never could we deny that the resources given by the government are limited, ranging from the area of the playground to the facilities in the gym. Furthermore, the sports teams need to practice every day, especially for the basketball, football, and handball, because these sports need to maintain a good teamwork. The areas of the court are just enough for the teams to practice. If we shared the court with the public, the daily practice of the teams would be affected. As a result, this measure needs to be improved.

Some people may argue that the citizens, as taxpayers, should have right to use the facilities at the school. Their physical health would be improved if they could use the facilities. Admittedly, some schools are subsidized by the government, people can use the facilities inside those schools. Actually, some activities held by the government are organizing at schools, the public can join those programs instead of getting into the school directly. We should also bear in mind that there are Direct Subsidized Schools. The parents in these schools need to pay an expensive educational fee, in order to give their children better place to learn. If the schools’ facilities are shared with the public, the parents may be discontented that their rights are deprived. In fact, there are many sporting machines existed in the parks. They are not used most of the times so that the citizens can make good use of them. Therefore, it is not necessary to open the school facilities to the public.

In conclusion, it is no doubt that the measure would bring negative consequences to the schools. I hope that people can consider the safety of students before supporting this issue.

Yours faithfully
Chris Wong

The areas of the court are just enough for the teams to practice. If we shared the court with the public, the daily practice of the teams would be affected. As a result, this measure needs to be improved.

Some people may argue that the citizens, as taxpayers, should have right to use the facilities at the school. Their physical health would be improved if they could use the facilities. Admittedly, some schools are subsidized by the government, people can use the facilities inside those schools. Actually, some activities held by the government are organizing at schools, the public can join those programs instead of getting into the school directly. We should also bear in mind that there are Direct Subsidized Schools. The parents in these schools need to pay an expensive educational fee, in order to give their children better place to learn. If the schools’ facilities are shared with the public, the parents may be discontented that their rights are deprived. In fact, there are many sporting machines existed in the parks. They are not used most of the times so that the citizens can make good use of them. Therefore, it is not necessary to open the school facilities to the public.

In conclusion, it is no doubt that the measure would bring negative consequences to the schools. I hope that people can consider the safety of students before supporting this issue.

Yours faithfully
Chris Wong
